meanings.definition: Work done within a specific period of time.
meanings.sent1: She completed all her timework before the school bell rang.
meanings.sent2: The project required careful timework to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The timework of baking cookies was a race against the oven timer.
meanings.sent4: His timework in the garden was like a symphony of tasks completed on time.
meanings.sent5: The timework of the ants gathering food was a lesson in efficiency.

meanings.definition: A system of organizing work based on time constraints.
meanings.sent1: The factory implemented a new timework strategy to improve productivity.
meanings.sent2: Her success in the project was due to her effective use of timework.
meanings.sent3: The timework schedule felt like a puzzle with pieces of time to fit together.
meanings.sent4: In the orchestra, each musician's timework was crucial for the harmony of the performance.
meanings.sent5: The timework of the train schedule kept the commuters on track.
